title: Langham Place hotel to be built in Dubai’s Business Bay by OmniyatTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Langham Place hotel to be built in Dubai’s Business Bay by Omniyat Published on : Tuesday, August 25, 2015
Dubai will be home to a brand new Langham Place hotel with the signing of agreement between the developer Omniyat Langham Hospitality Group, a Hong Kong-based hotel operator.
New Langham Place hotel in the Business Bay area of Dubai will be spread across 6,325-square-metre site and house a 167-room hotel, 271 serviced apartments – 438 units in all.
The project, estimated to cost Dh1 billion will be completed in 2018. It will also have four food and beverage outlets, including an all-day restaurant and a rooftop bar.
The signing in ceremony was held at the Langham Hotel in Hong Kong. Mahdi Amjad, Omniyat’s executive chairman and chief executive, said Langham Place “adds another prestigious brand” to its portfolio.
Lo Ka Shui, the executive chairman of Langham Hospitality Group, said he was confident about his company’s ability to fill the property, despite the growing pipeline of Dubai hotels.
